name: libxtst

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
libXtst provides the Xlib-based client API for the XTEST & RECORD
extensions. The XTEST extension is a minimal set of client and server
extensions required to completely test the X11 server with no user
intervention. This extension is not intended to support general
journaling and playback of user actions. The RECORD extension supports
the recording and reporting of all core X protocol and arbitrary X
extension protocol.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: libx11
dependencies.description: libX11 - Core X11 protocol client library.

dependencies.name: libxext
dependencies.description: libXext - library for common extensions to the X11 protocol.

dependencies.name: libxi
dependencies.description: libXi - library for the X Input Extension.

dependencies.name: recordproto
dependencies.description:
X Record Extension. This extension defines a protocol for the recording
and playback of user actions in the X Window System.

dependencies.name: inputproto
dependencies.description:
X Input Extension. This extension defines a protocol to provide
additional input devices management such as graphic tablets.

dependencies.name: fixesproto
dependencies.description:
X Fixes Extension. The extension makes changes to many areas of the
protocol to resolve issues raised by application interaction with core
protocol mechanisms that cannot be adequately worked around on the
client side of the wire.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.

dependencies.name: util-macros
dependencies.description:
This is a set of autoconf macros used by the configure.ac scripts in
other Xorg modular packages, and is needed to generate new versions of
their configure scripts with autoconf.

dependent_to.name: icedtea
dependent_to.description:
The IcedTea project provides a harness to build the source code from
https://openjdk.java.net/ using Free Software build tools and adds a
number of key features to the upstream OpenJDK codebase. IcedTea
requires an existing IcedTea or OpenJDK install to build.

dependent_to.name: qt
dependent_to.description: Qt is a comprehensive cross-platform C++ application framework.

dependent_to.name: xdotool
dependent_to.description: fake keyboard/mouse input, window management, and more

dependent_to.name: xts
dependent_to.description:
This is a revamped version of X Test Suite (XTS) which removes some of
the ugliness of building and running the tests.

dependent_to.name: xdpyinfo
dependent_to.description:
xdpyinfo is a utility for displaying information about an X server. It
is used to examine the capabilities of a server, the predefined values
for various parameters used in communicating between clients and the
server, and the different types of screens, visuals, and X11 protocol
extensions that are available.

dependent_to.name: keepassxc
dependent_to.description:
KeePassXC - Cross-Platform Password Manager, modern, secure, and open-
source.

dependent_to.name: at-spi2-core
dependent_to.description:
The At-Spi2 Core package provides a Service Provider Interface for the
Assistive Technologies available on the GNOME platform and a library
against which applications can be linked.

dependent_to.name: vim
dependent_to.description:
Vim is a highly configurable text editor built to enable efficient text
editing. It is an improved version of the vi editor distributed with
most UNIX systems. Vim is often called a "programmer's editor," and so
useful for programming that many consider it an entire IDE. It's not
just for programmers, though. Vim is perfect for all kinds of text
editing, from composing email to editing configuration files.

dependent_to.name: pulseaudio
dependent_to.description:
PulseAudio is a sound system for POSIX OSes, meaning that it is a proxy
for your sound applications. PulseAudio is a sound system for POSIX
OSes, meaning that it is a proxy for your sound applications. It allows
you to do advanced operations on your sound data as it passes between
your application and your hardware. Things like transferring the audio
to a different machine, changing the sample format or channel count and
mixing several sounds into one are easily achieved using a sound server.
